page.title: 18BURNFOOT CARNIVAL.
page.content: Burnfoot's Carnival was started in l969 by the Residents Association. It was intended for the benefit of the Burnfoot people, providing them with various entertainments and activities.Initially the Carnival Queen and her attendants were chosen by the headmaster of the local primary school, but later the Residents Association changed the system and put the names of all P.7 girls into a hat, and chose the Queen and her attendants by lot. The page boys were chosen by the staff of the Infant School.The Residents Association gave way to the Community Council who now run the Carnival. The Carnival Queen plays a central part in the festival . In l985 Karen Hogg was chosen and was crowned by Archy Kirkwood, the Liberal M.P. for the Borders. Karen's duties included a tour of local hospitals.
